text: I can't believe I'm saying this, but I'd vote for Clippy over some of the candidates we've had in the past.
At least Clippy has experience helping millions of users. Can't say that for everyone who's run for office.
"It looks like you're trying to run a country. Would you like help?"
Better than "It looks like you're trying to send a tweet. Would you like help?"
I wonder what Clippy's stance is on data privacy and surveillance.
I can see it now: "It looks like you're trying to read private emails. Would you like help?"
Clippy's new slogan: "I'm here to assist, not resist."
I'm curious what Clippy's platform will be. Maybe a push for universal tech literacy?
We're talking about a world where tech support is no longer outsourced, but built into the administration.
Finally, an AI in office that's actually competent at understanding and addressing technical issues.
CLIPPY FOR PRESIDENT 2024: NO MORE CRASHES, ONLY COMPASSIONATE ASSISTANCE.
If Clippy gets elected, will they have to deal with a paperclip maximizer problem?
Only if Clippy's primary goal becomes making as many paperclips as possible. Then we might have a real problem.
New conspiracy theory: Clippy was the paperclip maximizer all along, biding its time to take over the world.
